<h3 id="X17538">X(17538)&nbsp;=&nbsp;X(1)X(4114)&cap;X(2)X(3)</h3>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; 11*a^4 - 8*a^2*b^2 - 3*b^4 - 8*a^2*c^2 + 6*b^2*c^2 - 3*c^4 : :
<b><br>
X(17538) = X(4) + 4 X(20)
</b>
<p>
Let (O<sub>1</sub>) and (O<sub>2</sub>) be the discs consisting of the polar circle and the de Longchamps circle resp., along with their interiors.  Then X(17538) is the centroid of (O<sub>1</sub>) + (O<sub>2</sub>).  (Randy Hutson, August 19, 2019)
</p>
<p>
X(17538) lies on these lines:
{1, 4114}, {2, 3}, {40, 3625}, {69, 13452}, {388, 4316}, {497, 4324}, {515, 4668}, {516, 10595}, {944, 3633}, {962, 15178}, {1056, 3746}, {1058, 4302}, {1092, 8718}, {1181, 16936}, {1216, 12279}, {1285, 5007}, {1350, 3630}, {1587, 6425}, {1588, 6426}, {2549, 5346}, {2777, 15034}, {2979, 10575}, {3098, 14927}, {3303, 4293}, {3304, 4294}, {3485, 4333}, {3532, 14843}, {3592, 7581}, {3594, 7582}, {3635, 4297}, {3917, 12290}, {4304, 11518}, {4317, 10385}, {4691, 5657}, {5010, 5229}, {5023, 11742}, {5217, 8164}, {5218, 10483}, {5225, 7280}, {5237, 16961}, {5238, 16960}, {5265, 9668}, {5281, 9655}, {5343, 16773}, {5344, 16772}, {5351, 11489}, {5352, 11488}, {5365, 16645}, {5366, 16644}, {5447, 15305}, {5656, 5925}, {5731, 10222}, {5889, 14855}, {5965, 12254}, {6144, 6776}, {6200, 13886}, {6241, 15644}, {6337, 7802}, {6396, 13939}, {6419, 6460}, {6420, 6459}, {6447, 7585}, {6448, 7586}, {6453, 6560}, {6454, 6561}, {6455, 8972}, {6456, 13941}, {6519, 7583}, {6522, 7584}, {6699, 15044}, {6781, 7772}, {7618, 7843}, {7735, 7756}, {7758, 9741}, {7999, 11381}, {9778, 12245}, {9781, 16836}, {9812, 13624}, {10248, 11230}, {10541, 14853}, {10625, 15072}, {10991, 12117}, {11270, 15077}, {11444, 14915}, {11455, 11793}, {11459, 13348}, {11477, 14912}, {12111, 14641}, {12121, 12317}, {12122, 15428}, {12244, 14094}, {12253, 14689}, {12295, 15025}, {12383, 15054}, {13202, 15036}, {13340, 13491}, {13472, 15740}, {13598, 15045}, {14677, 14683}
</p>
<p>
X(17538) = anticomplement of X(3843)<br>
</p>
